library.description: A library in Cairo featuring & , %< books about all things you can't miss in Egypt.

book.title: Swimming Techniques
book.author: Basem Mostafa
book.preface: This book is for swimmers who want to learn all styles.

chapter.title: Freestyle

section.paragraph: Freestyle is the fastest swimming style.
You kick your legs up and down.
Your arms move one at a time.
Breathe by turning your head to the side.
Keep your body flat in the water.

chapter.summary: This chapter teaches you how to swim freestyle step by step.

chapter.title: Backstroke

section.paragraph: Backstroke is swimming on your back.
Your face stays out of the water.
This makes breathing very easy.
Move your arms like a windmill.
Kick your legs in a flutter motion.

chapter.summary: This chapter teaches you how to swim backstroke correctly.

chapter.title: Breaststroke

section.paragraph: Breaststroke is a slow and relaxing style.
Your arms push out and pull back together.
Your legs do a frog kick.
Lift your head to breathe each stroke.
This style is good for long distances.

chapter.summary: This chapter teaches you the breaststroke technique.

chapter.title: Butterfly

section.paragraph: Butterfly is the hardest swimming style.
Both arms move together over the water.
Your body moves like a dolphin.
You need strong shoulders for butterfly.
Practice dolphin kicks first.

chapter.summary: This chapter teaches you the butterfly stroke basics.

book.title: Egyptian Food
book.author: Chef Sherbiny
book.preface: This book is for people who love Egyptian cuisine.

chapter.title: Koshari

section.paragraph: Koshari is the national dish of Egypt.
It has rice, pasta, and lentils.
We add crispy fried onions on top.
The tomato sauce is spicy and delicious.
Koshari is cheap and fills your stomach.

chapter.summary: This chapter teaches you how to make authentic Egyptian koshari.

chapter.title: Roz Moammar

section.paragraph: Roz Moammar is Egyptian baked rice.
It is cooked with milk and cream.
The top becomes golden and crispy.
This dish comes from Upper Egypt.
It is served at weddings and feasts.

chapter.summary: This chapter teaches you how to make creamy roz moammar.

chapter.title: Mahshi

section.paragraph: Mahshi means stuffed in Arabic.
We stuff vegetables with rice and herbs.
Common vegetables are peppers and zucchini.
Grape leaves mahshi is very popular.
Cabbage mahshi is also delicious.

chapter.summary: This chapter teaches you how to make different types of mahshi.
